009package SpectralTechniques;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
013import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
014import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
015import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
016import imagingbook.spectral.dft.Dft2d;
017
018
019/** 
020 * This ImageJ plugin computes the 2-dimensional DFT (magnitude spectrum) from an image
021 * of arbitrary size using float arrays.
022 * Optionally, either a direct DFT or a fast FFT implementation is used.
023 *
024 * @author WB
025 * @version 2022/04/01
026 * 
027 * @see Dft2d.Float
028 */
029public class DFT_2D_Float_Demo implements PlugInFilter {
030        
031        private static boolean ShowLogSpectrum = true;
032        private static boolean UseFastMode = true;
033        private static boolean ShowCenteredSpectrum = true;
034        private static boolean ReconstructImage = true;
035        
036        private ImagePlus imp;
037        
038        @Override
039        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus imp) {
040                this.imp = imp;
041                return DOES_ALL + NO_CHANGES;
042        }
043
044        @Override
045        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
046                if (!runDialog()) 
047                        return;
048                
049                FloatProcessor fp = ip.convertToFloatProcessor();
050                
051                float[][] re = fp.getFloatArray();
052                float[][] im = new float[fp.getWidth()][fp.getHeight()];
053                
054                Dft2d.Float dft2 = new Dft2d.Float();
055                dft2.useFastMode(UseFastMode);
056                
057                dft2.forward(re, im);
058                
059                float[][] mag = dft2.getMagnitude(re, im);
060                FloatProcessor ms = new FloatProcessor(mag);
061                if (ShowLogSpectrum) {
062                        ms.add(1.0);
063                        ms.log();
064                }
065                ms.resetMinAndMax();
066                
067                if (ShowCenteredSpectrum) {     // strange this only works here (not before) - big in Blitter?
068                        Dft2d.swapQuadrants(ms);
069                }
070                
071                String title = (ShowLogSpectrum) ?
072                                imp.getShortTitle() + "-DFT (log. magnitude)" :
073                                imp.getShortTitle() + "-DFT (magnitude)";
074                new ImagePlus(title, ms).show();
075                
076                // ----------------------------------------------------
077                
078                if (ReconstructImage) {
079                        dft2.inverse(re, im);
080                        FloatProcessor reIp = new FloatProcessor(re);
081                        reIp.setMinAndMax(0, 255);
082                        new ImagePlus(imp.getShortTitle() + "-reconstructed (real part)", reIp).show();
083                        
084                        FloatProcessor imIp = new FloatProcessor(im);
085                        imIp.setMinAndMax(0, 255);
086                        new ImagePlus(imp.getShortTitle() + "-reconstructed (imag. part)",imIp).show();
087                }
088        }
089        
090        // -------------------------------------------------------------
091        
092        private boolean runDialog() {
093                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(getClass().getSimpleName());
094                gd.addCheckbox("Use FFT", UseFastMode);
095                gd.addCheckbox("Show logarithmic spectrum", ShowLogSpectrum);
096                gd.addCheckbox("Show centered spectrum", ShowCenteredSpectrum);
097                gd.addCheckbox("Reconstruct image", ReconstructImage);
098                
099                gd.showDialog(); 
100                if (gd.wasCanceled()) 
101                        return false;
102                
103                UseFastMode = gd.getNextBoolean();
104                ShowLogSpectrum = gd.getNextBoolean();
105                ShowCenteredSpectrum = gd.getNextBoolean();
106                ReconstructImage = gd.getNextBoolean();
107                return true;
108        }
109}
